website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you are looking for a "smart" and versatile way to bring music on board your boat; otherwise, check out others on our list for install models.
pros: Long-range connectivity (up to 33 feet) for Bluetooth music streaming
Small and easy to travel with
up to 10 hours of use per charge
cons: Not a permanent marine stereo, but some consumers like its portability

customer_reviews.title: It's a receiver.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Bluetooth receiver. It does exactly what you would expect it to do. Hence why I left it 5 stars. In all seriousness (for those who are actually using my review to make an informed decision) it does great work. I live in an apartment from the 40's and the walls are made out of plaster and typically Bluetooth devices have a hard time getting the signal through but as far as I can tell this receiver does a good job of relaying sound to my speakers in an unbroken manner.
customer_reviews.author: Clive Staples Leauis

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive way to Update an Older System
customer_reviews.text: Great little device for bringing an older sound system up to date. I have a 20+ year old NAD 7155 Receiver that I have been unable to part with because of its great sound. Unfortunately, it has no Bluetooth to connect with modern streaming technology. Now with this $20 item I am able to connect to Amazon Music via an Amazon Dot. And WOW!. I am back into modern times. Everything connected very easily with no problems. Not the greatest sound fidelity using the RCA cable but at least I have access to streaming without the need for a new receiver. Easily a 5 Star product for its price, performance and simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Greg J

customer_reviews.title: No Brainer
customer_reviews.text: I don’t often write reviews but I received this little jewel 60 min ago and I feel lucky (I was about to buy two speakers). I opened the box, grabbed the correct cord to plug into my non-Bluetooth sound bar, pushed the button and it showed up on my iPhone. Hit the screen and it connected. I hit the Apple Music screen and voila...unreal sound. I only used the sound bar for tv and I had now idea that it could blow out the windows with only my phone. No Brainer. Can not attest to long term integrity but you can find 20 bucks in the couch. Andy, Raleigh, NC
customer_reviews.author: Andy, Raleigh, NC

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: When connected to my iPhone, this device produces great sound through my old (1974) stereo receiver. That's what I bought it for. But the connection is annoyingly unreliable, cutting out frequently. Range is not the issue, as both receiver and iPhone are in the same room, perhaps 10 feet apart. I placed the phone within a foot of the receiver and it still cut out. This same iPhone works beautifully and reliably with my Rocketfish portable speaker, so the Bluetooth on the phone itself is not the problem. I'm too late to return it, and, frankly, $22 is not a great loss, but I recommend you do not throw your good money after my bad for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: I've used this for a year or two teaching an exercise class
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, I use this adapter - paired to a cheap Chinese phone (no SIM) as my player - to run playlists for group exercise classes. Used several times a week, for an hour each time, then recharge for next session. Purchased in 2017 - still going strong. Pairs quickly, cabeled into a broadcast amp/large speaker array. Most of the other instructors are still cabeling direct into their phones/mp3 players - this gives me the ability to not have to move back to the mic stand to adjust volume/modify playlist, etc. Good product, does exactly what it says, and it's small enough to easily carry in my gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I installed the receiver in my garage so i could use my phone too listen too music. I have a 24x32 space and i have no problems with reception inside the garage and I can go a decent ways outside before it starts too glitch. My main complaint is that instead of it turning on when i turn on my radio I have too turn it on separate, which really isnt a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rhino

customer_reviews.title: Less than average  product but works OK
customer_reviews.text: I have used several Bluetooth compatible peripherals over the years and this one isn’t one of the better ones. It is slightly difficult to navigate and set up. The most disappointing issue with this product is that the volume is significantly reduced during playback. In addition, this device has a tendency to disconnect between uses requiring a completely new set up with the sound source. Overall, this product is just OK and will work just fine for the casual user looking for an inexpensive way to add Bluetooth to a music device.
customer_reviews.author: Student77

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Bluetooth connectivity. Doesn't work at 10'
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 10.29.19: Etekcity shipped me a replacement unit (good customer service). Unfortunately, the very same issue occurred again. The Bluetooth pairs with my Peloton bike and will work for somewhere between 2 and 6 minutes. Then it makes the sound of powering off and loses the pairing, every time. And at a distance of about 10'. I cannot comment on whether this issue is isolated to Peloton devices, but if you are looking at this unit for a Peloton bike, choose a different product. I wanted to like this product. I guess it's too good to be true? The bluetooth loses connection doesn't maintain a connection and sometimes cannot connect at all. Either defective unit or just poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: John R Stewart

customer_reviews.title: A great product.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product 5 stars and reviewing it without having used it yet but I feel confident in doing so because this is the second one I have purchased. The first one I bought, about a year ago, works so well that I wanted another one to keep in our camper. The product is easy to install and operate, effortless to connect to via Bluetooth, and virtually turns any music player with an aux-in jack into a Bluetooth receiver. I will be using the new one during an upcoming camping trip next week. If there are any problems or issues with it I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Moseman

customer_reviews.title: 33 feet seems to be absolute max range.
customer_reviews.text: Even though I sent this back, I still have to give it 5 stars, simply because all of the claims are true. The sound quality is perfectly adequate, bluetooth connectivity is easy and connection distance is correct as described. 33 feet is the absolute maximum distance this receiver will function at. Unfortunately, the distance I needed this to function at was almost exactly 33 feet, with the source ( my Android phone) in my pocket, the signal breaks up. So if you are hoping to squeeze a few more than 33 feet(line of sight, unobstructed) you will be out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Keith Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Device is easy to set up and connects easily to my phone every time. range is very great as well. It is very small and the USB has decent range but would be nice to include a longer cord and plug. Input volume is low so you have to turn up your speaker higher than usual so if you switch between this and another input the volume has to be adjusted significantly. Also wish there was an easier way to turn it off but it seems to stay connected unless I turn off my bluetooth for a moment. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: cdapel

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget for Making Music Control Portable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I teach group fitness, and having my phone at hand to change music (instead of running over to the stereo) is seriously the best thing ever. I teach Zumba in a big gymnasium and the sound system is not close to where I stand. This precious little transmitter has been amazing for me. The sound quality is crystal clear,and I have had no connectivity issues. It died in me once in the middle of a class, but that was my fault for not remembering to charge it! I got probably about 6 hrs-ish worth of classes before I needed to charge it. This was a fantastic investment!
customer_reviews.author: The Raunch Dilettante

customer_reviews.title: Rescued - my older audio system with good sound!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Suddenly I'm freed from listening to all the commercials of mainstream radio! I have an older audio system (still handles cassette tapes!) but it has good sound - so I was thrilled to find an inexpensive way to stream internet music (Amazon, Pandora, etc.) Set up was simpler than simple and I've been listening for the last 8 hours - hardly realized it was time to get something to eat! Sound is so much better than my computer speakers, and I appreciate that it's just a little farther away from the computer so it's not like it overwhelms me while I'm working.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader

customer_reviews.title: Really spectacular device
customer_reviews.text: A pretty flawless product with great range, reliability and output quality. About once every 45 days, pairing with my iPhone fails for whatever reason and the two devices just can't find each other. I have to unpair the devices, restart the unify, and try again. Then we're fine for another month or two. My wish list: please, please, PLEASE let the unit stay powered on and discoverable when the unit is running on AC power instead of its own battery. I have this thing in my car, plugged in to a constant power source. I really hate having to hold the wake button for 1.5 seconds every time I get in. Don't make me do stuff, just pair!
customer_reviews.author: Jason R

customer_reviews.title: This is a great device And it works very well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device And it works very well, I hooked it up to the charger when I 1st got it and i charged it all the way up and then plugged it in ,and added my phone Bluetooth to it . It works great ,very convenient for what it is, I would highly recommend anybody that wants to get something like this that is totaly cordless... it lasts a long time on the battery so far . The only con about it is, if it's in pause mode for too long ,then it shuts off... otherwise it's an awesome benefit to Bluetooth and music on the go ..totaly portable and convenient..
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Cannot be charged while playing music, if the charger is plugged in the player disconnects from the phone. Design flaw, though the rest of this player is pretty good, small, light, a very good battery life for its size. Edit: Etekcity customer service shipped me a new version of this product after I posted this review. The new one CAN be charged while playing music. However, Etek customer service won't stop emailing me approximately once a month, asking me to please update the review. It's an odd combination of great customer service, and bad at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great combo of the price/simplicity/reliability!
customer_reviews.text: Great combo of the price/simplicity/reliability! Just bought a 3rd one over a few years. Previous ones went out either through my fault or lasted fantastically long for the price. Used it as car system Bluetooth conversion or, similarly, for originally non-bluetooth noise cancelling headphones with built in speakers while riding on lawnmower. Basically - any speaker that you can audio plug in, push a button and it's connected to your phone or such.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Works Better Than Claimed
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this Bluetooth receiver on an older Onkyo 7.1 receiver. The unit is attractive and perfectly matches the black color of the equipment it attaches to. Setup is simple and pairing the unit to my phone is effortless. Simply hold the button on the unit until it flashes blue and red. Scan for devices on your phone, laptop, etc. and you're done. Sound quality is superb and while the product is claimed as working at a distance of 33 feet or so I have found that there is no loss in sound quality at distances much farther (provided there is nothing blocking the devices). Wonderful product for adding Bluetooth capability to your existing stereo system.
customer_reviews.author: Coconut Crab

customer_reviews.title: This is a great gadget
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Easy to use - push the button and connect and play. I have it inside an entertainment center and my phone will work with it from 20 feet. Love not having to use a cable. Only glitch is when listening with headphones there's an occasional drop out in sound. UPDATED: after troubleshooting the audio drop out it appears that playing music from my phone is the problem. Playing from my tablet had no problems, and if I put my phone in airplane mode (all connections disabled except Bluetooth) there are no problems. Updating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good, BUT ...
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these some time ago, it set up and worked just fine. Until it didn't, a few weeks later. Customer service was first rate. They got a new one out to me pronto. It worked great, as advertised. Until it didn't, several weeks later. This time, customer service was silent. No response despite repeated tries. To this day, a couple of years later. I won't be repeating the order.
customer_reviews.author: Music Man

customer_reviews.title: Limited longevity.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a few months with very intermittent use. Then the right channel started to get garbled and break up. tried switching channels but problem followed. Tried different cables but same issue. Even tried different inputs on the stereo receiver. All to no avail. Very disappointed since i really enjoyed listening to my playlist while working in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Casillo

customer_reviews.title: Syncing and resyncing issues
customer_reviews.text: The product works ok but the flaw is you have to resync every time the power is off and on, for example im using this in my car, once the engine is off, its off which is ok but when you restart the engine, you have to resync which is annoying. Im returning and the one i have in my other cars, i sync once and thats it.
customer_reviews.author: Musiliu Aminu

customer_reviews.title: Music streaming made easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my non-bluetooth (music) infiniti G37x coupe. My aux input happens to be in a comparment right on the center where i pay my right elbow while driving. Simple to connect the wiring and and pairing it with my iphone7 plus. It has clear and good connection. But sometimes if the connection to the aux input had been moved slightly you will hear loss sound/signal and static. But its still portable enough to hide and just install it the best you can to hide any unwanted wires dangling on the center console.
customer_reviews.author: A. Estavillo

customer_reviews.title: Use on the boat stereo that didn't have bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these that I have bought - sold the first one with a different boat, so when I got a new boat I added this right away knowing that it works as expected. If you're stuck with an older model stereo, simply plug this into the aux port and you now have bluetooth - it doesn't get any easier. Would buy this again and again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: PROV431

customer_reviews.title: Good product but still has teething problems on my system.
customer_reviews.text: Good receiver. Have it connected to my old stereo system which makes great sound. I can now play Pandora or other on line music in the living room. Works flawlessly driven by my phone, but still not compatible with my 4 year old desktop which requires a transmitting dongle to connect. So far, that kind of connection is not reliable, but I believe the problem is in the dongle. Also, I perceive that the treble tones are weak. They don't seem as bright as when I play CDs or movies on DVD.
customer_reviews.author: RicknRedmond

customer_reviews.title: Good but flawed product.
customer_reviews.text: This product paired easily and sounded fine. However there is a low frequency thump after any change is made , such as ending a stream or an app. This may be what Felicia's one star review refers to. I notified Etekcity and they immediately replaced it. Unfortunately the second unit does exactly the same thing. I intend to keep it and try to remember to reduce the volume when the noise is expected. Note the thump is not loud but, like Felicia I am concerned it may damage speakers or headphones over time. Obviously a design flaw as it does not occur with a different bluetooth receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Mosessupposes

customer_reviews.title: *updated*
customer_reviews.text: ** update** Etekcity reached out to me immediately after posting my review. I have received a replacement unit and. Be testing shortly. I've increased my rating because I do really like this product and I am impressed with the customer service. Very useful, however, stopped working about 2 months after purchasing. Used only in one location, with an iPhone. One morning it just wouldn't power on. Had a red ring and then nothing. Won't charge. Pretty bummed that it stopped working, but I won't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: I love the compact design
customer_reviews.text: I love the compact design, but I didn't like that it needed to be paired by the push of a button each time you wanted to connect. I bought this as a second unit to stream music from my phone on my car, but had to return it for that reason. I had already owned a different unit (HomeSpot NFC-Enabled Bluetooth Audio Receiver for Sound System) which is $5 more expensive, but that one connects automatically once you get in the car, the same way your smart phone does when it connects to your car's Bluetooth for phone calls. I'd recommend this product if you don't mind manually pairing your phone each time.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This little box made it possible to run my phone thru my home stereo,with unlimited music sources, I can now crank it up as loud as I want effortlessly and sounds so good,decent bass,I'm not complaining at all,great for this application. If you listen to your music via phone and your home stereo just sits there...but this..you won't regret it
customer_reviews.author: GORDON GRIMM

customer_reviews.title: Great...Until it stops working
customer_reviews.text: This was the answer to my aging vehicle's problems with streaming from my phone to my audio system. It paired easily, sound quality was great, and I was all smiles. Unfortunately, it didn't last. I started losing connection with the device and having difficulty getting my phone to pair with it. I would have to push over and over again. If I hit a bump in the road and it moved the connection would be lost. I'm sad because those first couple of months were bliss. I'm still on the hunt for a great adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Lady

customer_reviews.title: Small, easy to use, and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This little bluetooth receiver works great. I plug it in the AUX cable in my car and home stereo to use my phone wirelessly. Has worked great so far. Only minor complaints are that you have to hold down the button to turn it off or on for a long time, maybe 5 seconds and that there is a significant delay when hitting the button to pause the playback (which could just be a function of the bluetooth on my phone).
customer_reviews.author: Another reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Bluetooth - But Light Never Stops Blinking!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the car. I finally was able to do away with dangerous wires coming out of my center console and in order to listen to music, TED talks, podcasts that are on my phone, I simply push the button and can easily connect. One downside that is especially annoying if you drive at night a lot... when the bluetooth is activated and connected to my phone, the blue light around the button NEVER STOPS BLINKING. It's very distracting at night. I don't notice it much during the day. Definitely something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth stewart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for several weeks and the product performed very well. It was packaged professionally. Instructions and operation were clear, simple and easy. Overall very well designed product. Additionally the company is very concern about their products performance and reputation. I received several emails from the company requesting honest thoughtful reviews. If I had any issues they have a solution department which was hyperlink to me email to resolve my concerns. Not your typical Internet company sending out cheap products. I am very impressed with there approach, product and packing and highly recommend Etekcity to anyone. Please note I have NOT received any products for this unsolicited unbiased opinion.
customer_reviews.author: John Castagna

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to update my stereo that is in the garage. I run channel "A" inside the garage and "B" out to the back yard. I was going to buy a new receiver with bluetooth built in so I can use my phone and have volume control. Then I found this and wanted to give it a try. I am so glad I did. The bluetooth connects with no issues and I can keep my phone in the backyard while streaming Pandora. The bluetooth receiver is connected to my stereo receiver in my garage and has to go through two walls one being brick. My kids also use this while in the backyard without issues.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This worked well. I didn't have any issues with sound quality or connectivity. The only thing I did not like was that I had to turn it on and then reconnect it to my phone. I found an adapter that provided autoconnectivity and some controls through my steering wheel. If that is not an option for you..this works!
customer_reviews.author: Product Junky

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised, have one at home and another in the car
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a while back to use with my home enetertainment system. They are better than i expected. They keep the music quality well and the volume with these are better than many bluetooth recievers by far even the more expensive ones. I bought another for the car and it also was a great idea and did not know why I didnt do this a long time ago. The NFC works great and it saves time. The only thing that if included would have made this a 6 star would be phone call capabilities. I would recommend this to a friend in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality. As good as the analog headphone jack.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a dozen different Bluetooth receivers to use in my car and all of them sounded "artificial" and tinny. Not this one. The Roverbeats Unify's sound is rich, clear, and accurate. The bass is good and not overly boomy and the highs are clear without being shrill. The NFC tap to pair is just awesome and works great. I get in the car, press the button once, tap the phone to it and the music instantly plays through the stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple. No major issues
customer_reviews.text: One annoyance on my Windows 10 desktop is the device stops communicating periodically and the easiest way too resolve it is to open the Sound Mixer "Playback Devices", right-click Disconnect the Etekcity, then right-click Connect to it. Sound is usually restored until it happens again. I disabled power management over the USB and other buses and it happens while actively using it. So it does not seem power management related.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to connect my Echo Dot to my wired speakers. It was often losing the connection and I had to re-pair the devices, so I couldn't even use it all the time. I also thought I could use the NFC with my phone, but that also never worked. Finally, after a few weeks, I just stopped working. I know it was the device because if I connected the wire directly to my headphone jack, it played just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frequently drops connection
customer_reviews.text: Got these to hook up to my kitchen light speakers that have a base station with a 3.5mm jack with the intent to connect my phone via BT and listen to my music, audiobooks, videos, etc while I'm cooking in the kitchen. Unfortunately, most positions of my phone get some strange interference and cuts out in a very annoying irritating way. I wanted to like these as Etekcity usually makes good products, and this looks good from an aesthetic point of view, but functionally just doesn't work for me. It does allow me to charge the device while using it at the same time which was a must for me, but the constant dropped connections just aren't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised! Once you have it plugged in (it comes with a variety of connectors), you just push the button to pair with your phone. I had issues with an older unit of mine failing to connect - contacted the seller and they were so responsive and friendly, sent me a replacement promptly with no issues, and i'm back to listening to music in my car.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical considering you constantly see commercials for the Google and Apple streaming music players. Well, down those that don't like to be stuck in a specific ecosystem this is a great, cheap way to ensure you can get all your music files played regardless if they're Apple's proprietary files or generic MP3. Easy to setup and the battery last a long time. Can pair to multiple phones.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Olson

customer_reviews.title: Etekcity scores again!
customer_reviews.text: Every item I've purchased from Etekcity has been spot on. I spent my entire career in the Consumer Electronics industry and i think i am able to know a good deal when i see one. Plain brown boxes, no-frills packaging, and top products inside. I highly recommend anything this company makes.
customer_reviews.author: Morey A Gottesman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I didn't know what to expect, but it does everything I had hoped for. Good range (I use it up to about 30'. . leaving it inside while taking my phone with me to the backyard pool. transmits fine through the sliding glass doors). Very easy to use, set up, switch phones. Small and sleek. Great sound (although I don't know enough about these things to know how much the bluetooth unit affects sound quality).
customer_reviews.author: YupYup

customer_reviews.title: For $19, you can put one anywhere you have speakers. Or, because it has a battery, move it around.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth or sixth bluetooth adaptor, and this is the best of the lot. The other one with NFC is the Homespot NFC one that is currently $29. This one is $19, AND includes a battery that allows you to roam around. It's great, has good build quality, and excellent user experience. It has one big button on the top of it. That button functions as play/pause, and pairing, and has two different colors of lights to indicate what it's doing. This is an amazing value at $20, and will allow you to easily connect your phone to any home theater setup without much concern. The NFC pairing makes connections SO fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ben G.

customer_reviews.title: Must be manually powered on every time
customer_reviews.text: When not in use it powers off, even when plugged in to a power source. I wanted to use it in my living room stereo cabinet, but having to go over and turn it on after any time I pause and restart the music just makes this unworkable. Otherwise it works fine, but what's the point of a wireless receiver that always has to be within arm's reach? Update: Etekcity took it upon themselves to contact me and offer a resolution, and it was totally hassle-free, so I just want to add my compliments for their excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: nozama

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Here we are, more than a year after purchase and having an odd failure of the device -- the output volume is at about 50%. I emailed Etekcity describing the issue. They responded immediately, asked for some clarification, and then sent me a new unit free of charge. Stellar customer service!
customer_reviews.author: rlk

customer_reviews.title: Great product, better customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've really been enjoying the receiver. When I received it I plugged it in and it immediately started working. I have an old sound system that still sounds great, and I wanted it to be Bluetooth enabled... this was the perfect solution. Only problem was it stopped working. For whatever reason I could not get it to pair with any device. So I got in touch with customer support, they apologized and offered to send me a replacement free of charge; I didn't even have to send back the original. Ever since I got the replacement it's been working perfectly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. easy to use. cant believe i didnt get one before. i got 2 real nice onkyo recievers in different rooms but neither has bluetooth. i was using the headphone aux on the phone to rca on the reciever for music. well now i got bluetooth and its great not having to be attached to that cable. some people will spend $300 buying a new reciever with bluetooth built in but why do that if for $20 you can have the same feature. i will be getting a new cable to connect to the optical on the reciever instead of rca,s since im sure it should sound better. Great inexpensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's meant to do
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly easy to use -- just plug in and connect via Bluetooth. It is small and pretty sleek, so that's a plus. I mainly use this for my car so that I can stream music from my phone without the use of an aux cord, and this product is perfect for it. It also has a rubber grip on the bottom that will help prevent it from sliding all over the place, if that's something you are looking for. When you buy this product, you get the bluetooth receiver, an aux cord, and aux to rca cord, a charging cable, and a charging adapter. A pretty solid buy in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Lilian N

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient little problem solver for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This little Bluetooth receiver has been really nice so far. I have 2 Bose Bluetooth speakers but can't play them at the same time from my phone. With this little guy I can play both of them for a nice surround sound effect when I am working and listening to my tunes. I realized I could use this on my home theater system also. Nice to have for the car as well. Just plug into the aux jack for Bluetooth connectivity. Battery lasts a long time and no glitches, frustration, rage, or other trouble so far.
customer_reviews.author: Honzik

customer_reviews.title: Etkcity and my Dot
customer_reviews.text: Picked this because it has good reviews and the price was right. I am using it with my Echo Dot. the Dot is sitting on my work bench in the garage. The stereo is mounted near the ceiling on the other side of the three car garage. The Dot to receiver was painless and quick. It has been working flawlessly for the past week. Liked it so much I am getting another pair, Dot and receiver for the basement. It will be replacing the Echo that is there now.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Coach

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great and the signal is solid. I read the reviews about tinny or poor sound, I have not experienced any issues. If you're a true audiophile you would know that streaming music or MP3's won't have the same quality as vinyl or a CD. We have this set up on our home component system and have paired it with a PC and Samsung Galaxy tab. Once paired the signal has been rock solid, I'd say the devices are 20-30 feet from the receiver. So far I'm very pleased with the bluetooth receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Bloostreakin'

customer_reviews.title: What I love about it is the weight and the quality feel ...
customer_reviews.text: Now I can take my tunes on my motorcycle! What I love about it is the weight and the quality feel of it! Some of these receivers are extremely light,which for me translate into easy to lose. But this one is compact but sturdy and it is simply, simply press and hold its large button, and you're on your way!
customer_reviews.author: Howard D

customer_reviews.title: Solid receiver, with some quirks.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bluetooth receiver to wirelessly connect my car (which lacks bluetooth for media) to seamlessly play music. Using this product daily for a couple months, the process has not been entirely smooth, though it works adequately with some patience. It automatically turns off (saving battery life), and I often have to manually connect to device. Sometimes, the bluetooth fails to connect with my phone or my phone fails to recognize the device. These problems are short-lived, and can be solved by restarting both the receiver and the device. It is a solid product and meets the bottom line, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Poh

customer_reviews.title: I almost purchased an entirely new stereo receiver to bring ...
customer_reviews.text: I almost purchased an entirely new stereo receiver to bring my music equipment into the 21st century. With this barely visible device, I didn't have to. I can now listen to streamed music through my wireless mp3 player and other Bluetooth devices and still listen to FM radio as well as my 70's turntable, 80's cassette tape deck and 90's five cd player. An inexpensive yet valuable product that solved all my music needs.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Just AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a car where I can use bluetooth for phone calls only, which is absurd and makes me think that the manufacturer of the car blocks the music streaming for you to upgrade your stereo. Having said that, I was always fristrated having to connect my phone with cordss and the car looks messy. This devixe is AWESOME and the sound might be slightly less bass but believe me is barely noticeable. If it bothers you, re-adjust your base and it will be as you want it again. I would recommend it to anybody!
customer_reviews.author: Hidaner Ferrer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and It works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought his product, to connect my under the kitchen cabinet Sony Radio/CD player to my tablet and play music from it. Set up was no problem, the instructions are very clear, and in no time had the Bluetooth receiver recognized by my tablet. The sound coming out from the Sony radio is very strong and clear. I am very happy with the Etekcity Bluetooth receiver and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound
customer_reviews.text: It connected easily, but the sound was of very poor quality. I tried it with two different devices and two different stereos, so the problem had to be in the bluetooth receiver itself. The Etekcity support staff was responsive and helpful, but this item was out of stock so they could not replace it under warranty. Perhaps it was just a bad unit, but I had to return it. Update: I got a different brand's Bluetooth receiver and the sound is fine. So this one really was no good.
customer_reviews.author: tautietis

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Only first days after install but early review is excellent. Solves the problem of having an older receiver and no bluetooth. Using the component wires for connection. Range is greater than stated. It is tiny (like 3" square) but very mighty!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great device especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 07 Audi to use with the AMI connector, instead of running a separate power supply I ended up just putting a battery bank in the glove box and it keeps the Unify going for a month between recharging the battery bank. Easily paired and good sound quality instead of spending 4x the price on other Bluetooth solutions to pair with the Audi AMI system.
customer_reviews.author: firehawk

customer_reviews.title: this product is amazing! i love the clear quality
customer_reviews.text: i cover it with my hands and it still gets signal! amazing product! worth the money for sure!!!!!!! the aux cable is meant for this product. i downloaded Decibel X app and it is a reader that tells you how loud it is when comparing to others and i compared wires and the one it came with is perfect compared to an older aux i have at home. This review is my own review i did not receive anything for free although that would have been cool but i am leaving this review for ppl like myself that are not sure if this product is legit or not! Don't settle for the 15 dollar ones they glitch a lot. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel l.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor button placement makes this useless for portability
customer_reviews.text: This thing ticks me off all the time! If you want something that is portable, that you can put in your pocket and carry around with you, look elsewhere! The single button is the highest point on the entire unit, virtually ensuring that it will be pressed at some point during use. While residing in jean pockets, I can't even walk without it shutting off, disconnecting, reconnecting, etc with each step. I've had it for several months, and I have tried to make the best of it -- it has worked very well overall -- but the physical design is too big of a flaw to overlook. I am shopping for a replacement for a perfectly working device.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Erekson

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to anything.
customer_reviews.text: This was a wash for me, should have tested it when I first bought it. Too small for a paperweight, oh well. I tried this with an Ilive sound bar, Plantronics headphones, and some cheap dollar store headphones, nothing would pair with them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Laveine

customer_reviews.title: It works exactly as expected - I plugged it into ...
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as expected - I plugged it into one of the A/C plugs on my receiver, so it comes on when I turn the stereo on, push the button, phone connects quickly, and I have range throughout most of my house. Really couldn't ask for more, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Bluetooth device
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few months now and has been working fine. I connected it to the video input of my receiver and it sounds pretty good. With my iPad or iPhone I can now listen to tunein radio, YouTube, and my Apple Music. So far I am very happy with it. It charges quite fast and could last for up to at least 6 hours, which is about my maximum listening time.
customer_reviews.author: hotrodsv

customer_reviews.title: great for parties
customer_reviews.text: I find this great for when people come over because almost everyone has bluetooth on their phone and thus can play DJ with the kind of music they want to share with the party. It pairs relatively painlessly and enables bluetooth connectivity to my existing stereo that did not come with bluetooth support
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I have my Apple TV in a closet about 25 feet away with the door closed and there are zero connectivity issues. I’m super impressed and definitely recommend. Pro tip: get a headphone splitter thingy so you can watch tv with your spouse while the kids sleep.
customer_reviews.author: JM SD

customer_reviews.title: It has never failed and the streaming quality is very good. The BT connects very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item for over a year now. It has never failed and the streaming quality is very good. The BT connects very quickly. Every once in a great while you might get a quick interference blip but that can be expected from any BT device. Nice product, easy to use and at a very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for connecting older stereo to wireless sources
customer_reviews.text: I refuse to give up late 80's Carver receiver but being 30 years old it only connects to outside sources via cables. With this device I can now stream content from my phone, iPad, Amazon Echo and Google mini. With this I can make my Mini sound big. Connecting it was simple - plug into power, plug RC cables into stereo and pair. The instructions were clear and concise. So far I am very pleased with this little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Low output current
customer_reviews.text: I bought mainly for music streaming. It works as advertised and sets up easily but doesn't work as expected. I didn't anticipate this unit to have such low output current. For all my other attached devices the volume setting on my AV receiver might be '-25.' For the same volume level I need to set my amp to about '-5.' Unaware, I nearly blew out my speakers when I changed sources. I dinged this unit on sound quality but the fidelity seems OK. Output current is just too low for my mid level AV receiver.
customer_reviews.author: TRDM

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Package that paired seamlessly with Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: This little box pleasantly surprised me and as the headline says, after charging, installed and paired seamlessly with our Echo Dot. The sounds quality is pretty good, although not as good when I pair my phone through Google Chrome. I still need to tinker with the EQ. One of the things I am not sure about it is if it can be plugged in and then recharged as the power drains rather than pulling it out on the audio side to recharge as required. I also appreciate the follow-up email that Karen (from Etekcity) sent. IT may be just standard CRM but I did appreciate it!
customer_reviews.author: sbelville

customer_reviews.title: Lasts on and on and sounds great!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I got me and my husband both one. We don’t travel far for work so it lasted us for 2 months on battery life. And that’s with us not turning it off when getting out and waiting for it to do it on its own. Sounds great and haven’t had any problems with it. Always automatically pairs with my phone once turned on. Love love love! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alternates between good and completely unusable
customer_reviews.text: Nice packaging, good solid feeling product, although accessory cables and AC adapter felt incredibly cheap. Easy initial setup, and for a little bit, seemed to work okay as a Bluetooth speaker to my Google Home Mini. After being connected for a couple minutes, the sound would become spotty and scratchy until a reset. A complete waste of money, and incredibly dissapointed. Just get a Chromecast Audio, that's what I'm going to do, mine has never had an issue like this.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: I like this device
customer_reviews.text: I like this device, works as advertised so I can play streaming music on my aging component stereo. However, twice now it has lost the Bluetooth connection (no, not too far away, I know about BT's distance limitations, etc.) Once it refused to reconnect, I thought it was broken -- unplugged everything, fooled with it and the smartphone a bit, after 15 minutes got it to re-pair. I've only had it for a couple weeks, may revisit this review after more time ...
customer_reviews.author: S. Skolnik

customer_reviews.title: Pairs easily and sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: Nice receiver. As I type it’s hooked to a USB to charge and connected via Bluetooth to my Amazon Fire. I’m using Sennheiser MX 365 earbuds and the Pavarotti sounds great. The only small gripe which I only noticed after listening is that the volume control is at the source, in my case the Fire tablet; there are no volume controls on the BT receiver.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: " Ten minutes later he was back helping wrap because set up was so ridiculously easy and it just worked
customer_reviews.text: We got this yesterday, December 23 and we were wrapping presents. I said to my husband, "Well, you're going to be busy with that now." Ten minutes later he was back helping wrap because set up was so ridiculously easy and it just worked. Like he said, "I love it when things just work." No kidding!! We have been listening to Spotify throughout our house because of this awesome little device! So happy!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Best one I tested so far
customer_reviews.text: I thought I don't need to add another review because there are already so many reviews for this product. But I am so happy with this product so here it is. It really does a good job. Battery life is long. Last whole day without recharging. It makes all my earphone sound wonderful after the bluetooth connection. Lightweight. I don't need to buy the extremely expensive bluetooth earphone, all I need is this and a regular wired earphone.
customer_reviews.author: J Seal

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my car and it works flawlessly. I have an older car with an aux line and I've purchased other cheap Bluetooth solutions before finding this one. Do yourself a favor and buy this one if your planning on using it in your car just for music. I've used other ones that kept breaking and malfunctioning after about a month. This receiver is built solid and I haven't had any problems with it. Battery lasts a long time and is rechargeable while in operation. It syncs up to my iPhone without any issues and I can enjoy my music without any fuss. It can also be used on other equipment which is a plus. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: PandaMoto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain.  Does exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to hook up I couldn't believe it. I have a vintage 70's receiver, plugged the included RCA cable into the AUX jacks on the receiver, pressed the button on top of the bluetooth adapter, it paired instantly with my HTC one M8 phone and I was playing MP3's for the rest of the day. This bluetooth adapter from Etekcity is just exactly what I was wanting and by playing off my phone I can also control the volume. Sweet!!! For the money you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: LoKo126

customer_reviews.title: User Error?
customer_reviews.text: I installed bought this for my laptop because the speaker out port is flaky. If the laptop goes to sleep I have to disconnect and reconnect the receiver in the blue tooth settings to get it to function again, not cool.
customer_reviews.author: 22 Utah Snow

customer_reviews.title: Too much noise
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2010 Jeep with Infinity Audio. The 'digital noise' between tracks was some of the worst I've heard. Nice design and clean to install, but I'll keep my FM modulator version for now. Sending this one back
customer_reviews.author: James Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these. They work really well, sound great and have really long battery life. I recommend for an inexpensive solution. The only downside, and the reason it has only 4 stars, is there is no battery life indicator on your phone or device while it’s in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected, no hassle
customer_reviews.text: Before I connect my smartphone phone jack to my Accuphase Power Amp to play music. Now I connect via this bluetooth receiver. I felt the sound quality is better than connect through phone jack using cable. My smartphone can see and connect this bluetooth receiver out of the box, very easy, no extra settings. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Fung

customer_reviews.title: I have bought 4!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 because my friends from work keep asking to get them one... why is that well because their really great and convenient works well one charge latest about 7-8 hours of use their small and can be place a anywhere audio quality is great and won't break up the communication.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Valdez

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Versatile Bluetooth Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device so much I ordered a second one. It’s a great value for the price. This receiver even connects up with my “dumb” Bluetooth transmitter. The battery has lasted 8-12 hours without a problem. It’s perfect for connecting an older stereo system or pc speaker system (my porch stereo system) to my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Man With A Plan

customer_reviews.title: Great and Reliable little bluetooth receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I use this with my Yamaha integrated amplifier. It works great to stream music - totally reliable. I have had it for about year with no issues - and i use it almost every day. The only downside is that it "sleeps" after some period of non-use. I'm dinging it for that -it's probably something that most people appreciate. I would recommend this to anyone and would buy again if I had the need.
customer_reviews.author: Tarek K. Dhanani

customer_reviews.title: Bring your old Sound Systems back from the Dead.
customer_reviews.text: This little gizmo works great. I hooked this up with the provided RCA cables to an outdated, but still awesome used speaker-dock I just bought secondhand. Within seconds I was paired up and blasting tunes from my iPhone 6. I've since tested its range and it performed as promised. As I type this, my new Frankenstein sound system is paired to my Apple Macbook Pro and working without a hitch. If you've got an old stereo, boombox, or old iPod dock collecting dust I highly recommend this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Holiday

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t overpower other bluetooth sources in the home
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. After reading reviews about the other adapters on Amazon overpowering other bluetooth adapters in the home, I gave this one a try and I’m very happy. Super easy to discover and connect.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Kribstock

customer_reviews.title: Very nice solution to make your headphones or car audio Bluetooth capable!
customer_reviews.text: This item is fantastic! Exactly what I was looking for, and has no flaws in operation. Pros: Easy to pair and use, single button provides all functions (power, play/pause, skip, pair/unpair) Good battery, easy to charge and keeps playing while charging (something my $400 Bose headphones can't do....) The company has excellent, friendly customer service Lightweight, you won't notice it in your pocket Cons: The only thing I didn't like is it takes like a 7 second press to turn it off, kind of annoying after a while
customer_reviews.author: Devon Tibbils

customer_reviews.title: Pleased As Punch!
customer_reviews.text: What a magical little device. Streaming anything bluetooth playable from my iphone to my stereo. Sweet! Holds the connection between charges.Recharges by USB and you can have it plugged-in / recharging while you use it. Sweet product. Holds a charge for about 10 for me and recharges quickly. Loved the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin P. Ringold

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: I have this used for my outdoor system. My receiver is an old Marantz receiver and everything to get it going came in the package. Meaning the red and white to headphone cable was included. Have used this on the weekends only for 2-4 hours per time and this lasted a few weeks. Very impressed. And I usually stick with brand names but this definitely does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Redid the basement entertainment center recently, so wanted to find something I could plug into my old Onkyo AV Stereo. It has better sound than my bluetooth speaker. Now I can run my audio apps from my phone thru the stereo. Decent enough range, but in all honesty, at most I'm not further than 15-20 feet from the bluetooth receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen0720

customer_reviews.title: Great product - works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Through the first few days, this has been great. For me, it sits in my console. I get in, start the car, then hit the giant button on the top to turn it on. No fumbling through iPhone menus - just hit play on your podcast, play list, etc. Price seemed fair, value seems good. I'll circle back if issues arise, but so far this thing does exactly what I needed it to, which is add Bluetooth music to a vehicle that only has an aux in. Good size, great packaging. Actually about to see if this company makes a set of Bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: User since  August 15, 2017.
customer_reviews.text: I am just now experiencing charging issues. I have had at least 16 months without issues of daily use. This product exceeded my expectations. It still works after almost a year and a half. My need from this product is to turn my headphones into a wireless headset. If you are skeptical of transitioning to Bluetooth wireless, this will meet your expectations. Though, where do I go from here? Should I research a product that meets my expectations?
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Bluetooth that goes wherever you might need it.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing has come in handy more than a few times. I have an old audio system in the house that I moved in to and it happened to have an Aux jack. With this I can have music from my phone piped to the entire house without having to connect to a wire. I have also used it in a few random situations where there was access to a speaker that I wanted to connect wirelessly to. Easy to use, sounds good, decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because my ipod dock on my home ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my ipod dock on my home theater stopped working. This indicated that it plugs into the headphone jack on your stereo. That didnt work. I had to use the aux cords in the back. Unfortunately, my aux plugs were already in use by another component so, it ended up being an either or situation, depending what equipment I wanted to use. That wasn't going to work at all. I maybe could have found another solution BUT, I also discovered that I couldn't leave the room with my cell phone that I was streaming music from, or it with fade in and out. back it went
customer_reviews.author: Amber E

customer_reviews.title: No Frills and works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use. Connects easily. Small form factor is nice. Easily adds BT connectivity to anything that you can adapt a 3.5mm (aux cable) to. You need to buy this. Even if you think you don't need it get it, you'll find a use for it.
customer_reviews.author: D P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to connect my smartphone & tablet to a Klipsch audio system to listen to my music. The setup was a breeze, simple and easy. The sound is clear and I hear little difference between the Etekcity and a direct corded link. Of all the Bluetooth devices I own this is overall the best one I have.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo Rider

customer_reviews.title: Great When It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit for my car. It was easy to setup the first time but then when I got back in my car and wanted to use it, I had to do a complete reconnect. It didn't just start up like my other Bluetooth speakers.
customer_reviews.author: M.Perez
